com.percussion.cms.objectstore
Class PSCoreItem

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSDbComponent
      com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSItemComponent
          com.percussion.cms.objectstore.PSCoreItem
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPSCmsComponent, IPSDbComponent, IPSItemAccessor, Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
PSClientItem, PSServerItem
public class PSCoreItem
extends PSItemComponent
implements IPSItemAccessor

The base class for items in the CMS layer. This class does all of the heavy lifting by providing the implementation for the majority of functionality . It is database unaware.

There are 2 ways to populate an instance w/ existing data, by supplying an xml document in the StandardItem.xsd format, or by calling the various protected and public methods to allow setting of the data.

Constant Field Values

INVALID_REVISION

public static final int INVALID_REVISION
The value to incidate that a revision is not valid to the item and that it may be ignored. For example new items do not have any revision value and empty or null cannot be used for Java primitives like int, therefore this value will be used to indicate that a revision is invalid.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INVALID_CONTENTID

public static final int INVALID_CONTENTID
This value is used to indicate an id has not been set on this object yet. This occurs for new objects.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

isRevisionLocked

public boolean isRevisionLocked()
Once an item has gone public, the revision lock gets set, after which on every update the revision will change.

Returns:
If this item is locked this method will return true and means that it has gone public and the revision id will be incremented upon update. Otherwise false.

isRevisionLocked

public void isRevisionLocked(boolean locked)
Sets the locked state.See isRevisionLocked() for a description of locking.

Parameters:
locked - true if it is locked otherwise false.

toMinXml

public Element toMinXml(Document doc,
                        boolean includeFields,
                        boolean includeChilds,
                        boolean includeRelated,
                        boolean includeBinary)
Return the minimum XML constrained to the sys_StandardItem.xsd schema based on the following flags:

Parameters:
doc - the parent doc from which to create the elements, never null
includeFields - include all fields in the return doc
includeChilds - include all the child fields in the return doc
includeRelated - include all the related fields in the return doc
includeBinary - include binary fields in the return doc - does not apply to binary fields in children.
Returns:
a document representation of a subset of this Core Item

equals

public boolean equals(Object obj)
Description copied from interface: IPSCmsComponent
Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. All implementing classes must override this method as the default behavior is incorrect for deep clones. If the implementation does not follow the contract documented for this method in Object, then it must clearly state how it deviates from that contract. The following algorithm should be used:
  1. Call the base class (unless Object) and if true is returned, continue.
  2. Compare all members of current class.
  3. If all members are equal, return true.

Specified by:
equals in interface IPSCmsComponent
Specified by:
equals in interface IPSDbComponent
Overrides:
equals in class PSDbComponent
Parameters:
obj - the reference object with which to compare. May be null;
Returns:
true if this object is logically equivalent to the supplied obj; false otherwise. If null or not an instance of this class, false is returned.

loadXmlData

public void loadXmlData(Element sourceNode)
                 throws com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSUnknownNodeTypeException
This method is called to populate an object from its XML representation. It assumes that the object may already have a complete data structure, therefore method only overlays the data onto the existing object. An element node may contain a hierarchical structure, including child objects. The element node can also be a child of another element node.

Specified by:
loadXmlData in class PSItemComponent
Parameters:
sourceNode - the XML element node from which to populate. Must not be null.
Throws:
com.percussion.design.objectstore.PSUnknownNodeTypeException - if the XML element node does not represent a type supported by this class.

getCheckedOutByName

public String getCheckedOutByName()
Returns the name of the user who has checked this item out. This value is set by the system. If not checked out by the user, this item cannot be saved.

Returns:
the name of the user who has checked this item out. May be empty if this is a new item or if loadXmlData() or ServerItem.load() hasn't been called. Never null.

setCheckedOutByName

public void setCheckedOutByName(String checkedOutBy)
Sets the name of the user who has checked this item out.

Parameters:
checkedOutBy - a username of the person that has this item checked out, may be empty, never null.
See Also:
getCheckedOutByName()

resetRevisions

public void resetRevisions()
Resets all revisions to INVALID_REVISION. The new Java API and web services do not expose the revisios anymore to the user and will be reset before its returned.

getRevision

public int getRevision()
Returns the revision of this item. The revision cannot be incremented.

Returns:
the revision for this item. If a new items is requested the INVALID_REVISION will be returned.
See Also:
INVALID_REVISION

getDataVariant

public String getDataVariant()

Returns:
never null or empty.

getContentTypeId

public long getContentTypeId()
Returns the contentTypeId of this item.

Returns:
int must be >= 0.

getRequestedRevision

public int getRequestedRevision()
Returns the revisionid that was requested. It may not be the same revision that is returned. If the requested revision is has the revision lock set, a new version of the item will be cloned and returned with the new revisionid. If a new items is requested the INVALID_REVISION will be returned.

Returns:
see this methods description.
See Also:
INVALID_REVISION

setRequestedRevision

public void setRequestedRevision(int requestedRevision)
Sets the revision provided for in the original request for the item.

Parameters:
requestedRevision - must be > 0.
See Also:
getRequestedRevision()

getCurrentRevision

public int getCurrentRevision()
Returns the current revisionid.

Returns:
the current revision is the revision in the contentstatus table, if there is none the default INVALID_REVISION will be returned.
See Also:
INVALID_REVISION

setCurrentRevision

public void setCurrentRevision(int currentRevision)
Sets the current revisionid. The current revision is the revision in the contentstatus table.

Parameters:
currentRevision - must be > 0.

getEditRevision

public int getEditRevision()
Returns the edit revisionid. The edit revision is tip revision. The revision being returned for editing.

Returns:
if this is a new item the default INVALID_REVISION will be returned.
See Also:
INVALID_REVISION

setEditRevision

public void setEditRevision(int editRevision)
Sets the edit revisionid. The edit revision is tip revision. The revision being returned for editing.

Parameters:
editRevision - may be < 0
See Also:
getEditRevision()

getRevisionCount

public int getRevisionCount()
Returns the total number of revisions. This is the same value as the edit revision.

Returns:
if there are not any revisions INVALID_REVISION will be returned.

getSystemLocale

public Locale getSystemLocale()
Returns the Locale used by the system.

Returns:
Locale may be null.

setSystemLocale

public void setSystemLocale(Locale systemLocale)
Sets the Locale of the system that is using this item. This is expected to be set by the client. This is not the "Rhythmyx" Locale.

Parameters:
systemLocale - the Locale to set. Must not be null.

getDataLocale

public Locale getDataLocale()
Returns the Locale of this items data. This is the value that's set in the contentstatus table.

Returns:
Locale may be null.

setDataLocale

public void setDataLocale(Locale dataLocale)
Sets the Locale of the data of the item.

Parameters:
dataLocale - the Locale to set. Must not be null .

Set the folder paths of this item.

Parameters:
